Quote.Speaker: Fake Jim
Quote.Text: Morning, Dwight

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Who are you?

Quote.Speaker: Fake Jim
Quote.Text: Who am I? I'm Jim. We've been working together for twelve years. Ha, Weird joke, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're not Jim. Jim's not Asian

Quote.Speaker: Fake Jim
Quote.Text: You seriously never noticed? Hey, hats off to you for not seeing race.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Alright then Jim. Ahhh, why don't you tell me about that sale that you made yesterday?

Quote.Speaker: Fake Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, Wellington systems? Sold them 10 cases of 24-pound letter stock. Or, were you talking about Krieger-Murphy? Because I didn't close that one yet, but I'm hoping I've got a voicemail from Paul Krieger waiting for me.

Quote.Speaker: Voicemail
Quote.Text: Please enter your password.

Quote.Speaker: Voicemail
Quote.Text: You have one new message.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How did you know? No! No, no! That is sensitive information only for employees, not outsiders!

Quote.Speaker: Fake Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, cut it out, I'm trying to work.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You don't work here! You're not Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim, I got us that dinner reservation. Grico's at 7:30.

Quote.Speaker: Fake Jim
Quote.Text: Oh great, can't wait. [Kisses Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim's at the dentist this morning. And Steve is an actor friend of ours.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't know who you are, but you are not Jim. This is Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Dwight shows fake Jim of the Halpert family portrait but notices that Jim and the kids have been replaced with fake Jim and Asian kids]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh my--! Oh d--! Oh, how did--? [gasps] Huhhhhh!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Heyyy! Study buddies!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh, ok.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Getting things done. Awesome!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's all about finding ways to make yourself more efficient. Life hacking, baby. This morning, I brushed my teeth in the shower. Saved my self 90 seconds. Which I just used to explain this to you. Damn it!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Since Andy promoted me to assistant regional manager, I've been trying to step my game up, you know, be more productive. In fact, you know what? Let's knock out a few more of these sound bites while we're here. [pauses] Whoa! That person has really gotten him or herself into quite a predicament.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [speaking in French] S"il vous plait...dites-Moi...Ugggghhh les Bleagh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ah, French. It's a great language. If you're a chain-smoking acrobat.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm just trying to fit in better with Andy's family. They all speak more than one language. Usually when I'm there!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You wanna learn a really impressive second language? Try dothraki. Win over any man in my guild.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dothraki is the native tongue of the nomadic war-mongering horse lords of Essos as featured in the superb Home Box Office series, Game of Thrones. It has a lot of nudity. Which I fast-forward through to get to the chopped-off heads.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I could teach you if you want. It's a lot easier than French.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah! Let's do it!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [exclaims] Atherozar!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [shocked] Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It means "excellent". And we have begun.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [asks Nellie who is tapping a pen on her desk]. Is everything okay?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Hmm? Oh--oh, yeah. Yeah, yeah, yeah, fine. Fine, fine, fine. I'm mean, I d--I just don't wanna--burden you with my massive stress freak outs!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: It's just that I am taking my driver's license test in two days, and I need to practice with an experienced driver in the car. But I've had no time to do that, thanks to "Demandy"...[Points to Andy's office with her thumb]. I just want to hit the open road and drive, man! But...in who's car?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [yells] Nellie! Get your wrinkly old balls in here.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nellie, I could practice with you in my car at lunchtime.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, Pam, thank you! You are my savior! [hugs Pam]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie and Pam
Quote.Text: [giggling] ohhhhhhhhhhhhhh!!!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Jim] I'm sorry, I'm leaving you alone for lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Don't worry about it. I have a thing. A thing of soup. Which I've been wanting to try.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: This is my research into how we might produce child-proof paper that doesn't give you paper cuts. We can't. And here is a print out of your genealogy from thisisyourfamilytree.com

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Executive-summary me. Hit the highlights.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well, it turns out, you are a distant blood relative of Michelle Obama!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: As in...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Wife of Barack, loves gardening, wants to wipe out fat children.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [silently mouths] Wow!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is super-flattering. She's the most popular person in America. This is a big day for both of us.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: My fellow Americans, I have a feeling my approval rating is about to go through the roof. Turns out, I am related to Michelle Obama.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I was intimidated by Andy's family before. And now I have to see the First Lady at holidays? She's gonna be like, "What's your stance on politics?" Or, "What is the best war to do?" And, I will just be like, "Duhhhh!"

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright! We gotta get rid of all this junk food. Get fit, America! Not sure if the buzz has reached the annex yet, but uh...I'm related to Michelle Obama.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Clark and Peter clap]

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Yeah we noticed early on, Andy really appreciates enthusiasm.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: So we decided the best way to get ahead here is to be his cheerleaders.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Oooohhhhhhhh!

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [They clap when Andy slams dunks his garbage into the bin]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [They clap when Andy prints a paper copy out]

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [They clap when the water cooler jar makes bubbles while Andy is standing next to it.]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: It's starting to have this reverse effect, though, where I really do think the stuff he does is awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Yeah, me too. It's weird. Hard to remember what's real at this point.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Just clap through it, man.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You log in sales at ten different times. If you log 'em all at once, you save a lot of time. It's called batching.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That was really good, Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Life hacking, man.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: There he is!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Andy, you gotta check this out. He just showed me--[gets interrupted by Andy].

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [shushing Jim] Ahhhthathathathathta. Right now I need canned tuna, okay? Darryl, guess which talented individual, who also has a killer singing voice, is related to the First Lady?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Tracee Ellis Ross. Daughter of the First Lady of Motown, Diana Ross.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's me! [chuckles] I am related to Michelle Obama.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What?! Really?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I mean, it's distant, but...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [chuckles in agreement] Huh ha! That's cool, man.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Right?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Darryl said, "Cool, man." He called me as cool man.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know, I really do think it would be worth it to pull over and just take ten minutes to eat.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Mmmm--the thing is Pam, I'm gonna be eating while I'm driving, so, I might as well get good at it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Brake lights. Break lights! Break lights! Break lights!!!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Whhooooo!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm just saying, what does it imply in this country when a white person shares an ancestor with a black person?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You think that Andy's family owned slaves?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Well somebody owned somebody. And I don't think anybody would buy an Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I throat-rip.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Foth aggendak!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You throat-rip.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Foth aggendi!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He/she/it throat rips.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Foth aggenda!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: More of a, barbaric growl.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [in a barbaric growl] Forth aggenda!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Louder! You're shouting it from the back of a horse!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Wah!! Aggenda!!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Pretty crazy about Andy and Michelle Obama, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [laughs mischievously] Yeeeeahhhh! It's almost unbelievable!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well, you know how Andy has been really salting my onions, lately.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Well, when he asked me to look up his ancestry online, I remembered that news story about Michelle Obama having white relatives, and I just knew he would eat that up!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So he's not related to Michelle Obama?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Pam, I barely know how to turn on my computer.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nellie's pretty fearless. And I think she might be maybe even almost sort of fun.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [whispers] Pam! [she pretends to slam a wrench over the tire service guy's head].

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well, if there's another explanation, I don't really see what it could possibly be. I--[gets cut by Andy barging into the convo]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What's going on here? I'm related to the first lady, okay? Get over it. [chuckles] I still need weekly status reports from most of you, sooooo, can we get back to work, please? Get back to work! [Mimicks smacking everyone with a whipl].

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Andy! Andy! No! I would be very polite today.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why? Is it employee's day or something? I cannot keep track of these BS holidays.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Your connection. To Michelle Obama has certain... negative connotations. Most likely, your family were--slave owners.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Does anyone else think it's possible that I come from slave owners?

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [everyone raises their hands.]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Whoa! That person has really gotten him or herself into quite a predicament.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey mom, it's Andy. Give me a call when you get a chance gotta quick question for you, uhhhh no big deal just about America's national shame, thanks, Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Continues] Where were we? Uhhhh, yes. Okay. Your...productivity thing.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yes, yes, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Great. Ooo! Spreadsheets! Yum, yum!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I included some time saving ideas...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Huh huh huh. Look, I'm not gonna lie to ya, I'm a teensy bit distracted right now.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Look, Andy, even if your ancestors did own slaves, it wouldn't be your fault. This is only weird if you make it weird.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [snaps his fingers] Right on, brotha. Wurddd.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Addor!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Daraas!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Qazer!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Daraas! [asks the rest of the office] Does anyone here have fermented mare's milk?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Hey Erin!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Azem choma! Chomakka-attun!

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Oh--okay. Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, still, it must great to have something else going on outside of work.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah--turn signal. It's exciting to be painting again--those are the wipers. So--the--its--just. There you go! Yeah. [chuckles] Yeah, things get so busy with the kids--red light--that it's nice to have that creative outlet--red light! Red light! Red! Red!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: That is brilliant, Pam. I would love to see some of your work.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, since we're stopped at a light, uhhh, here is...the mural I did for Angela's baby.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: That's amazing, Pam! Oh, I love the lion in the tuxedo!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Angela insisted that all the animals be fully clothed.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [to Erin]. Heyyy, has anyone turned in their status reports up here?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Vos!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So, no? You think maybe you could remind people? I'm trying to down play the whole bossy boss thing today.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Because of your slaves.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Not my slaves, my ancestors'. Maybe. Probably not.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, if it makes you feel any better, the dothraki word for "slave master", "attafrauk!", is a term of respect. I'm learning how to speak dothraki! Color you impressed?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That you're learning a made-up language from HBO's Game of Thrones? I have a lot going on today...but this was a great nerd-out!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Dwight, you didn't tell me you were teaching me a fake language.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: People laughed at Klingon at first, and now you can major in it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hi guys.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hey boss! I am so thirsty. Could I have a scoop of water?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. You don't have to ask me.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Phyllis lets out stifled laughter]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ha ha! Okay. Great. Very funny. I get it. Just because my ancestors happen to be--[ringtone of Dixie plays]. Very funny, Kevin. Changed my ringtone. Very funny. I liked the original song on my ringtone, which, you may remember, was "Diamonds on the Soles of Her Shoes" by Paul Simon, featurinnnngg Lady Smith--African American--Mambazo.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good. Very good. [cell phone beeping]Oh--no! Here. It's, uh, a text from Andy. "New special proj. Need fam tree for evbody. Really dig up dirt A.S.A.P." And then in parentheses, he wrote out "as soon as possible."

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Mm. Ugh, looks like its pretend-y time again. Write back, "looking for dirt."

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, can I help? We could say someone is related to, uhm, Tonya Harding.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Pam, I'm related to Tonya Harding.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh--gee--I'm--

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: No! I'm just practicing my lyyiiinggg! [whispers] I love it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Brilliant!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: What should we say about Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ummm. Oh! I'll say he's related to Richard Nixon. It's an inside joke. He looks really Nixon-y when he wakes up.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: My ex behaved like Nixon. All of the lying. None of the sexual charisma. [pauses] I just made a joke there.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm sorry. It's just, uhm, I actually do have this weird feeling that there's something Jim isn't telling me.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh no! Oh! An affair! It is always an affair!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim? No.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [sighs]. How can you be sure?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Because he just loves me too much.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: You're a cocky little thing, aren't you, Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I've done a little genealogy research of my own. Turn out I'm not the only one with a few skeletons in the ol' family closet. For example, Phyllis's great-great grandmother was responsible for spreading cholera to the United States.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ew.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Kevin is related to both John Wayne Gacy and John Wayne Bobbitt.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: And John Wayne?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. Not that I see here.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wayne Johnson? The Rock?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You mean Dwayne? And no. What about Jim Halpert? Uh oh! Turns out, distant relative of the reviled, Richard Nixon!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam always says I look like Nixon. That's crazy, right? I mean there's nothing there. True--[touches his nose] Oh no.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dwight's grandfather was a--[is interrupted by Dwight].

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Was a member of the Bund. Which is not technically the same thing as the Nazi party. So...[clears throat]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I was gonna say he was a tax evader.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh. I was joking about that whole Bund thing. Oh ho, the look on your faces! Hahhahahahahah! Hahahahahah!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And Meredith is a blood relative of Lizzie Borden.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Cool! Ah! Ah! Ah! Ah! [mimics stabbing into Angela's throat]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Stop it! Stop it! You're frightening me!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Andy, did you call this meeting just to talk junk about our families?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, that--you're being really mean, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, I'm proving a point, okay? We all have ancestors who may have done horrible things in the past. But it's in the past and it's not our fault. So we don't have to talk about it.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: The difference is, Andy, that you're the only be here still benefitting from the terrible things that your ancestors did.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Might've done. And how... do you figure?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Your family's rich! I have to believe that a big part of the Bernard fortune was earned on the backs of slaves.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know, there's nothing wrong with being successful in America, Oscar! I'm not gonna apologize for my family's wealth. That wealth, could one day benefit society...if capital gains are ever taxed as the same rate as earned income.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [ringtone of Dixie plays] Okay, Kevin did that. I do not wish I was in Dixie.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [answers phone] Hey mom, how are ya? Did any Bernards ever own a plantation in the south?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [to the group] She said no! Take that!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [gets back on phone] Follow up question. Did any Bernards, ever, make money, in an unsavory way?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [speaks quietly into the phone] I just asked you! Why didn't you just say that?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [continues speaking quietly] Oh, stop! Stop! Stop talking! Stop taking! That's--no! I don't wanna know that. Ok. You're interrupting a meeting I have to go. Love you. Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [faces the group] Well, turns out the Bernard's of yore did not own slaves.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We merely transported them. Which at worst, makes us amoral middlemen.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Clark begins to clap but Pete immediately stops him.]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yo, d-dog. I need your help. I'm trying to think of things I can say that make it sound like I had a more difficult childhood than I actually had.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You're gonna po' mouth

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Exactly. Help me po' mouth, Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Actually, Andy, you promised me five minutes to talk about productivity suggestions--

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What if I said that my dad beat me. And, I just left out the croquet of it all. Or, I could just go all the way and just say I grew up in an apartment. Or is that too crazy?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That could work.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You now, Darryl, this is textbook assistant regional manager stuff here, and I feel like I'm doing all the heavy lifting. I'm coming up with all the ideas here.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'm going for a walk.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [with a sigh] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good. Good. And--[Nellie hits the car against the bushes]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You doing alright, man?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'm done. I gotta get out of here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Not the easiest day to be assistant regional manager.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's not just today, it's everyday. It seems like the better title I have, the stupider my job gets.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, come on, it can always get better. Right?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hmm. Yeah right

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I'm serious. There's always something better.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Like what?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Like hypothetically... if I said there was another job. That you and I could both have.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What kind of job?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Something cool. Like, sports marketing or... that sound something like you'd be into?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hell yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That sounds awesome!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, but wait. What if I told you that it was in Philly! So you'd have to...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I love Philly!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's not even a thought--

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not even a thought! It's not even that far away! I could still commute! Exactly. Exactly! Alright!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What? Wait, wait, wait? So what? This happening?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, it's happening! Let's just keep it between you and me for right now.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah. Yeah, yeah, yeah. For sure. For sure. for sure. Man! And Pam's into it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We, uh, we haven't talked about. But I think that she's--I think she understands... what this is.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh, come on, man. I thought you had something real.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What? No, no, no! Come on! This is real!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's not real... until your wife is on board.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So what did you want to show me?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: That is quite an ugly wall, isn't it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. It's really ugly

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Needs something, doesn't it? I'm thinking...a mural.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You mean me?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yes! You! You are soo talented! It's going to be my next special project. Hiring Scranton's most dangerous young muralist to paint the warehouse wall.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my god! I love it! Uh, I--Nellie, this is brilliant! [sees Jim] Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey! Can I talk you? For a second?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Anything you have to say to her, you can say to me. She never loved you!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?! No! I-I got this. [Laughs] Okay?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [quietly] This is his fault. It is not your fault. I'm gonna find you someone better, and rich.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: And Filipino. But we'll break that to her later.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [to Darryl] You know what this is all about.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah. You too, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Yeah. Go on, spill it. Tell her all the gory details, youuuu sssnake!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey! He deserves this. And he said I could get in on it too. [whispers] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Ohhh, Pam, nooo! Oh, I can't bear to watch this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know what I was so worried about. I have the best wife in the world.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I still can't believe he didn't tell me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I was helping Nellie drive--[Stanley interrupts]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Do not care.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Fonas chek!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Dothraas! chek! [giggles]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I like that guy. We should hook him up with Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [in agreement] Hmmm!
